topic: johnson & johnson strikes deal with u.s. government to lower drug prices

text: A major pharmaceutical company has made a significant deal with the US government to lower prescription medication prices.

identity_keyword: US Department of Health and Human Services
text: The agreement was reached after months of negotiations with the US Department of Health and Human Services.
The goal of the deal is to increase access to affordable medications for low-income families and seniors.
The deal will affect a range of prescription medications, including those used to treat chronic conditions.
The price reductions will range from 10 to 20 percent for certain medications.
The price cuts will take effect starting March 1, 2026.
The price cuts will apply to both Medicare and Medicaid recipients, as well as privately insured patients who meet certain income requirements.
Patient advocacy groups and healthcare experts have welcomed the news.
It remains to be seen how the price reductions will impact the pharmaceutical company's bottom line.
The deal may prompt other pharmaceutical companies to follow suit.
The potential long-term effects of this deal on the US healthcare landscape are still uncertain.
Further investigation is needed to understand the implications of the deal.
The deal has sparked interest in the pharmaceutical industry and its impact on healthcare.
The future of affordable healthcare in the US may be shaped by this groundbreaking deal.
